SEARCH
Package Background

Class KeyHandler

java.lang.Object
Background.KeyHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
KeyListener, EventListener
public class KeyHandler extends Object implements KeyListener
Description:

Handles keyboard input for movement and bomb control using the KeyListener interface. Tracks the state of directional keys (W, A, S, D) and space bar (bomb drop).

Author:
mguzelocak, Zelele

  • Constructor Details

    • KeyHandler

      public KeyHandler()

  • Method Details

    • isBombDrop

      public boolean isBombDrop()
      Returns whether the bomb drop action is triggered.
      Returns:
      true if the bomb drop is active, false otherwise.

    • setBombDrop

      public void setBombDrop(boolean bombDrop)
      Sets the state of the bomb drop action.
      Parameters:
      bombDrop - true to activate the bomb drop, false to deactivate it.

    • keyTyped

      public void keyTyped(KeyEvent e)
      Not used but required for implementation of the KeyListener interface. This method is called when a key is typed, but it's not needed in this case.
      Specified by:
      keyTyped in interface KeyListener
      Parameters:
      e - the KeyEvent triggered by typing a key.

    • keyPressed

      public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e)
      Handles key press events. It updates the movement direction flags and triggers bomb drop action.
      Specified by:
      keyPressed in interface KeyListener
      Parameters:
      e - the KeyEvent triggered by pressing a key.

    • keyReleased

      public void keyReleased(KeyEvent e)
      Handles key release events. It resets the bomb drop action and movement direction flags.
      Specified by:
      keyReleased in interface KeyListener
      Parameters:
      e - the KeyEvent triggered by releasing a key.

    • isUpDirection

      public boolean isUpDirection()
      Returns whether the up direction movement is active.
      Returns:
      true if the up direction is active, false otherwise.

    • setUpDirection

      public void setUpDirection(boolean upDirection)
      Sets the state of the up direction movement.
      Parameters:
      upDirection - true to activate the up direction, false to deactivate it.

    • isDownDirection

      public boolean isDownDirection()
      Returns whether the down direction movement is active.
      Returns:
      true if the down direction is active, false otherwise.

    • setDownDirection

      downDirection - true to activate the down direction, false to deactivate it.
